data.title: AMERITECH, BELL ATLANTIC TO SHARE NAME AND NUMBER FORSHARE NAME AND NUMBER FOR CALLER ID ON LONG-DISTANCE CALLS
data.meta_description:
FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE
February 7, 1996              



AMERITECH, BELL ATLANTIC TO SHARE NAME AND NUMBER
                FOR CALLER ID ON LONG-DISTA
data.text:
FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE

February 7, 1996

AMERITECH, BELL ATLANTIC TO SHARE NAME AND NUMBER

FOR CALLER ID ON LONG-DISTANCE CALLS

Chicago, IL/Arlington, VA -- Customers of Ameritech and Bell

Atlantic

soon will be able to receive name as well as number information for

long-distance calls originating from the Midwestern and mid-Atlantic

regions served by the two companies.

Caller ID customers nationwide have been receiving number information

only for long-distance calls originating in many parts of the United

States since Dec. 1.

Some telephone companies, including Ameritech and Bell Atlantic,

already provide name information for calls within their own service

territories. This name information is available to Ameritech

customers who subscribe to Caller ID with name and Bell Atlantic

customers who have Caller ID Deluxe.

By March 1, Ameritech and Bell Atlantic will begin sharing Caller ID

name information. As a result, their customers will see the caller's

phone number and the name associated with it when calls originate

within the other company's territory.

In a joint statement, Mendel Hamrick, director of new-product

development at Ameritech and Margaret Gardner, director of value-added

services at Bell Atlantic said: "We're pleased to be able to offer

our customers an enhancement that will give them more of the Caller ID

information they're looking for from even more areas of the country.

They told us they want it. Now, we're providing it, helping to make

this highly popular service even more valuable."

Ameritech and Bell Atlantic are the second among the regional Bell

operating companies (RBOCs) to share name as well as number

information. Ameritech and US WEST were the first RBOCs to do so in

December. Ameritech and Bell Atlantic said they expect to negotiate

similar sharing agreements with other companies in the months ahead.

Residential customers of Ameritech can order Caller ID by calling

1-800-709-LINK .

(1-800-709-5465). Business customers of Ameritech can order the

service by calling 1-800-PROFITS (1-800-776-3487).

Residential and business customers of Bell Atlantic can order Caller

ID Deluxe by calling their local Bell Atlantic business office. The

company is currently offering new residential subscribers a credit on

their phone bill which can be applied to the purchase of a Caller ID

display unit.

Local phone companies who want more information about how to link up

with Ameritech on Caller ID name delivery can call 847-248-4443, or

e-mail angela.ring@ameritech.com. Those

who want to link up with Bell

Atlantic can call Sean Coombs on 301-282-4010, or e-mail

michael.s.coombs@bell-atl.com.

Ameritech, one of the world's largest communications companies, helps

more than 13 million customers keep in touch. The company provides a

wide array of local phone, data and video services in Illinois,

Indiana, Michigan, Ohio and Wisconsin. Ameritech is creating dozens

of new information, entertainment and interactive services for homes,

businesses and governments around the world.

Also one of the world's leading wireless companies, Ameritech serves

more than 1.8 million cellular and 750,000 paging customers, and holds

cellular interests in China, Norway and Poland. Ameritech owns

interests in telephone companies in New Zealand and Hungary and in

business directories in Germany and other countries. Nearly 1 million

investors hold Ameritech (NYSE:AIT) shares.

Bell Atlantic Corporation (NYSE: BEL) is at the forefront of the new

communications, entertainment and information industry. In the

mid-Atlantic region, the company is the premier provider of local

telecommunications and advanced services. Globally, it is one of the

largest investors in the high-growth wireless communication

marketplace. Bell Atlantic also owns a substantial interest in

Telecom Corporation of New Zealand and is actively developing

high-growth national and international business opportunities in all

phases of the industry.
